Feeling anxious, or demotivated? Tap for friendly advice on how to manage your ADHD.
This alarm clock is designed to get you out of the bed. Place a barcode away from your bed. When the alarm goes off, scan the barcode with the app\'s barcode scanner to turn off the alarm.
Scan any barcode with this scanner to turn off the alarm
Or Tap Three Times To Turn Off Alarm
Take a break and practice self-talking. Imagine a close friend around you, and start talking out your heart. Discuss your fears, thoughts, and plans. Trust me, it helps.
Try the 4-7-8 breathing technique. Breath in for 4 seconds. Hold your breath for 7 seconds. Then exhale forcefully for 8 seconds.Repeat the cycle 4 times. You\'ll feel a lot better.

Let\'s slow down a bit. You are probably thinking way too deep. Take a piece of paper and a pen. Start dividing the problem into the smallest possible steps. Talk yourself through each step. Then start solving from the first step.
Get up and start walking. Keep repeating to yourself that you are very fast and deep analytical thinker. Assert your confidence, and then divide up the task at hand into small manageable chunks,

Remember your ADHD has blessed you with fast, creative, and analytical thinking. You are a natural risk taker, driven, and ambitious. All you need is structure and some motivation. Morning workouts can be as effective as medication. Try it!
